SENT.plain: A 40-year-old man was admitted with acute onset of slurred speech and right hemiparesis
Cerebral infarction was diagnosed from magnetic resonance (MR) images
Chest X-ray incidentally revealed a posterior mediastinal tumour, which proved to be seminoma on CT-guided biopsy
Five months later, right upper limb weakness and slurred speech occurred again
Brain MR images revealed two metastatic lesions in the prior infarct areas, which on histology proved to be metastatic seminoma
